hanzi-su-wiki:
淵

Значения

Омут, пучина, бездна

Мнемоника

Водоворот возникает там, где воде 氵 мешает течь преграда.

Варианты

渊, 渕

deep pool; deep; profound
глубокий бассейн; глубокий; глубокий

Antonyms: 天
Pictophonetic: 片 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: The abyss [old] used to be the water you were pushed into if you lost in the arm wrestling match.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: abyss, edge, deep pool, the depths
Ru_Meaning: abyss, edge, deep pool, the depths
Ru_trainchinese: yuān: (графема) пучина, бездна; глубокий водоем
Kanshudo_mnemonic: water (氵) on the right (片) and left (爿) falls into the abyss
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you go deep into the abyss of ocean water and make it back in one piece, you mind need some crutches and rice to recover.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The outside of the oracle bones is from an oval frame, and the inside is from " water ", like water in a pool. The original meaning is deep water pool.

The inscriptions on the inscriptions are drawn from the vertical pen on the left and right sides of the elephant, with " water " in the middle, like the shape of Yuantan. Shen Zitagui superimposed water next to " 𣶒 " as a symbol. The shape of Shiqiangpan is a further change of Yuantan.

Oracle is used as a place name. Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to express the abyss. Zhongshan Wangding: "Rather than squeeze (drown) in others, ning 汋(drow) in 𣶒 (yuan)." "Da Dai Li Ji. "Wu Wang Jianyan": "The inscription on the toilet plate says: "Rather than drowning in people, I would rather drown in the abyss. You can swim in the abyss, but you can't save yourself if you drown in the abyss."" "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Xiao Min": "Like facing the abyss, like walking on thin ice." It also means deep, the history wall plate: "𣶒 (Yuan) King Zhekang", "Little Erya. "Guang Gu": "Yuan, deep." "Yuan Zhe" means deep and wise.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The outside of the oracle bones is from an oval frame, and the inside is from " water ", like the shape of water in a pool. The original meaning is deep water pool.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文外面從橢圓形邊框，裏面從「水」，象水在潭中之形。本義是深水潭。

　　金文從象左右兩岸的豎筆，中間從「水」，象淵潭之形。沈子它簋於「𣶒」旁疊加水為形符，史牆盤字形是淵潭之形的進一步訛變。

　　甲骨文用為地名。金文用作本義，表示深淵，中山王鼎：「與其汋(溺)於人也，寧汋(溺)於𣶒(淵)。」《大戴禮記．武王踐阼》：「盥盤之銘曰：『與其溺於人也，寧溺於淵。溺於淵猶可游也，溺於人不可救也。』」《詩．小雅．小旻》：「如臨深淵，如履薄冰。」又表示深，史牆盤：「𣶒(淵)哲康王」，《小爾雅．廣詁》：「淵，深也。」「淵哲」即深沉而有智。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文外面從橢圓形邊框，裏面從「水」，象水在潭中之形。本義是深水潭。

①深水，潭：淵水。淵谷。淵林。淵藪(“淵”，魚所聚處；“藪”，水邊草地，獸所聚處；喻人或事物聚集的地方)。深淵。臨淵羨魚(喻只作空想，不作實際工作)。
②深：淵博。淵源。淵浩。淵玄。淵邈。淵儒。淵識(精深的見識)。
③姓氏。

甲骨文外面從橢圓形邊框，裏面從「 水 」，象水在潭中之形。本義是深水潭。 金文從象左右兩岸的豎筆，中間從「 水 」，象淵潭之形。沈子它簋於「 𣶒 」旁疊加水為形符，史牆盤字形是淵潭之形的進一步訛變。 甲骨文用為地名。金文用作本義，表示深淵，中山王鼎：「與其汋(溺)於人也，寧汋(溺)於𣶒(淵)。」《大戴禮記．武王踐阼》：「盥盤之銘曰：『與其溺於人也，寧溺於淵。溺於淵猶可游也，溺於人不可救也。』」《詩．小雅．小旻》：「如臨深淵，如履薄冰。」又表示深，史牆盤：「𣶒(淵)哲康王」，《小爾雅．廣詁》：「淵，深也。」「淵哲」即深沉而有智。
Elaboration: The outside of the oracle bones is from an oval frame, and the inside is from " water", like water in a pool. The original meaning is deep water pool. The inscriptions on the inscriptions are drawn from the vertical pen on the left and right sides of the elephant, with " water" in the middle, like the shape of Yuantan. Shen Zitagui superimposed water next to " 𣶒" as a symbol. The shape of Shiqiangpan is a further change of Yuantan. Oracle is used as a place name. Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to express the abyss. Zhongshan Wangding: "Rather than squeeze (drown) in others, ning 汋(drow) in 𣶒 (yuan)." "Da Dai Li Ji. "Wu Wang Jianyan": "The inscription on the toilet plate says: "Rather than drowning in people, I would rather drown in the abyss. You can swim in the abyss, but you can't save yourself if you drown in the abyss."" "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Xiao Min": "Like facing the abyss, like walking on thin ice." It also means deep, the history wall plate: "𣶒 (Yuan) King Zhekang", "Little Erya. "Guang Gu": "Yuan, deep." "Yuan Zhe" means deep and wise.

Liushutong characters (12)

淵字的基本解释

淵
yuān
见“渊”。

淵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuān］
［《廣韻》烏玄切，平先，影。］
“囦1”的今字。亦作“渆1”。亦作“渕1”。“渊1”的繁体字。
(1)回水；回旋之水。
(2)深潭。
(3)人或物汇集之处。
(4)深邃，深沉。
(5)通“鼘”。鼓声。亦泛用作象声词。
(6)姓。春秋时齐国有渊湫。见《世本·氏姓》。

淵字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　淵； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页632第08
〔古文〕?囦?【唐韻】烏圓切【集韻】【正韻】營圓切【韻會】幺圓切，?音?。【說文】回水也。从水，象形。左右岸也，中象水貌。【管子·度地篇】水出地而不流者，命曰淵。　又深也。【詩·衞風】秉心塞淵。　又潭名。【水經注】伊水東爲淵潭。　又淵淵，鼓聲。【詩·小雅】伐鼓淵淵。　又姓。世本有齊大夫淵㰬。　又【集韻】一均切，音蜵。亦深也。

淵字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
淵字的起名意思

暂无。

deep
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yuān］
["Guangyun" Wu Xuanqie, Ping Xian, Shadow. ]
The present character of "囦1". Also known as "渆1". Also known as "渕1". Traditional characters for "Yuan 1".
(1) Backwater; swirling water.
(2) Deep pool.
(3) Where people or things gather.
(4) Profound and deep.
(5) Through "鼘". drum. Also widely used as onomatopoeia.
(6) Last name. In the Spring and Autumn Period, Qi State-owned Yuanqiu. See "Shiben·surname".
deep
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Siji 1】【Shuizi Department】　yuan; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: Page 632 08
[Ancient text]? 囦? [Tang Yun] Wuyuanqie [Jiyun] [Zhengyun] Yingyuanqie [Yunhui] Yaoyuanqie, "yin?". [Said the text] Back to the water. From water, pictogram. The left and right banks also show the appearance of Zhongxiang water. [Guanzi·Dudi Chapter] Those who don't flow when the water comes out of the ground are called Yuan.　It's also deep. 【Poetry·Weifeng】Bing the heart into the abyss.　The name of Tan. [Shui Jing's Note] Yishui East is Yuantan.　Yuanyuan again, the sound of drums. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Fighting Drum Yuanyuan.　Another last name. There is Dr. Qi Yuan in the world.　[Jiyun] All cut, sound. It is also deep.
